sops.title: SOP 1: Interpreting Stem-and-Leaf Diagrams
sops.goal: Quickly and accurately extract mode, median, and mean
steps: Count Total (N): Write N beside the diagram—this controls the median
Mode: Scan for the most frequent leaf (recombine with stem)
Median: Position is (N + 1) ÷ 2. If N odd → whole position (e.g., 11th). If N even → average of the two middle values (e.g., 13th and 14th)
Mean: Sum all values (stem+leaf) and divide by N. Use calculator carefully

pitfalls.text: For even N, forgetting to average the two middle values

pro_tips: Write N = … on top before doing median
When N is even, pre-write Median = (____ + ____ ) ÷ 2

sops.title: SOP 2: Interpreting Grouped Frequency Tables
sops.goal: Estimate the mean from a grouped frequency table
steps: Midpoint (x): For each class, midpoint = (lower + upper) ÷ 2. Example: (140 + 150) ÷ 2 = 145
Compute fx: Multiply midpoint x by frequency f

pitfalls.text: Using interval boundaries instead of midpoints
Forgetting to compute an fx column for each row

pro_tips: Add explicit columns for Midpoint (x) and fx
Do totals (Σf, Σfx) in a separate line to avoid slips

sops.title: SOP 3: Solving Basic Probability Problems
sops.goal: Accurately calculate the probability of an event
steps: Total Outcomes: Identify the size of the sample space
Favourable Outcomes: List them explicitly (do not 'do it in your head'). Example: 'even and divisible by 3' → list evens, then circle those divisible by 3: 6, 12, 18
pro_tips: Always list the favourable outcomes—never rely on mental counting
Reduce the final fraction (or convert to simplest decimal/percentage if required)
